content: Write a sonnet about stars where every line starts with the same letter.

Shining stars in the velvet night,
Silent sentinels of celestial might.
Softly sparkling, they guide and gleam,
Secret stories in their light they beam.

Starry skies, a canvas vast and wide,
Spectacular sights that captivate and abide.
Serene and steady, their radiance burns,
Symbolizing hope in life's dark turns.

So I stare up, in awe and in wonder,
Seeing shapes and patterns, a cosmic blunder.

Yet in their brilliance, I find my way,
Through the darkest nights, they light my day.
